decoworld.model.world

Class WorldProviderManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • decoworld.model.world.WorldProviderManager

  • public class WorldProviderManager
extends java.lang.Object
    WorldProviderManager handles the main providing of Worlds, by delegating the provideWorld() method to the correct abstraction, such as IOWorldProvider, default WorldProvider, magicalPonyWorldProvider(), etc.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WorldProviderManager

        public WorldProviderManager()

    • Method Detail

      • setDefaultProvider

        protected void setDefaultProvider(WorldProvider provider)
        Sets the default 'WorldProvider' object. Whenever a World is requested whose name does not match a registered prefix, this provider is the one which attempts to fulfil the request.

        This should be set to IOWorldProvider on the Server and (eventually) a networked provider on the client. This should not be set to a custom World provider, except perhaps for testing purposes.

      • registerProvider

        public void registerProvider(java.lang.String prefix,
                    WorldProvider provider)
        Registers the given provider to supply all World requests, where the requested World name begins with the given prefix. (Example: The World called "dungeon_hard-stone-boss-1654154894789" may be provided by a custom World provider, and "house_user-azurediamond" may be provided by another)

        It is suggested that prefix always end with '_' and contain '_' only once. This will prevent clashes (Which provider is called is unspecified if two are registered with, for example "my_prefix_" and "my_").

        For now this should be called on the Client as networking isn't complete, however in future there really should be only 1 provider on the Client (A provider which just forwards the request to the Server, which checks its own list of registered providers server-side to determine how the request should be fulfilled).

        Example: wpm.registerProvider("dungeon_", new DungeonWorldProvider());

        Parameters:
        prefix - the worldName prefix for which to call the given provider for.
        provider - the WorldProvider which will be called for any matching request.

      • provideWorld

        public World provideWorld(java.lang.String name)
        Dispatches to the correct WorldProvider.
        Returns:
        the requested World, or null if there was an error.

      • provideMap

        public Map provideMap(java.lang.String name)
        Provides just the Map for the given world name.
        Returns:
        the Map instance for the given World's name, or null if there was an error or a Map is not applicable.
